Package controllers

The controllers package contains two kinds of classes to handle client requests.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AdminController  
    Application
    The application controller for general purpose tasks such as logging in and out.
    Application.ForgotPassword  
    Application.Login
    A static class made for the purpose of generating a form.
    Application.Password
    A form filler for the password form used in creating a a new user
    CoordinatorController  
    LearnerController  
    Secured  
    SecuredAdminAction
    Authentication for actions that should only be executed for Admin users.
    SessionController
    The session controller for tasks that involve adding, deleting and editing sessions.
    TemplateController
    The controller for creating and editing schedule and session templates.
    TemplateController.PreSession
    Helper class for validating user-provided information to create a new session template.
    TemplateController.PreTemplate
    Helper class for validating user-provided information to create a new schedule template.

Package controllers Description

The controllers package contains two kinds of classes to handle client requests.

Controller Classes

Controller methods handle actions according to the conf/routes file.

Controller classes named after classes in the models package are concerned with general CRUD operations:

  • LearnerController
  • SessionController
  • TemplateController

Controller classes named after user types (AdminController and CoordinatorController) are concerned with actions that these users can perform via their respective views.

The Application class handles actions related to creating/modifying user credentials.

Security Classes

Security classes (Secured and SecuredAdminAction) restrict access to controller actions based on the kind of user that is logged in.
